docstring:
"""
    A class that can act as a client for testing purposes.

    It allows the user to compose GET and POST requests, and
    obtain the response that the server gave to those requests.
    The server Response objects are annotated with the details
    of the contexts and templates that were rendered during the
    process of serving the request.

    Client objects are stateful - they will retain cookie (and
    thus session) details for the lifetime of the Client instance.

    This is not intended as a replacement for Twill/Selenium or
    the like - it is here to allow testing against the
    contexts and templates produced by a view, rather than the
    HTML rendered to the end-user.
    """
name: Client

methods.docstring:
"""
        The master request method. Compose the environment dictionary and pass
        to the handler, return the result of the handler. Assume defaults for
        the query environment, which can be overridden using the arguments to
        the request.
        """
methods.name: request

methods.docstring: """Request a response from the server using GET."""
methods.name: get

methods.docstring: """Request a response from the server using POST."""
methods.name: post

methods.docstring: """Request a response from the server using HEAD."""
methods.name: head

methods.docstring: """Request a response from the server using OPTIONS."""
methods.name: options

methods.docstring: """Send a resource to the server using PUT."""
methods.name: put

methods.docstring: """Send a resource to the server using PATCH."""
methods.name: patch

methods.docstring: """Send a DELETE request to the server."""
methods.name: delete

methods.docstring: """Send a TRACE request to the server."""
methods.name: trace

methods.docstring:
"""
        Follow any redirects by requesting responses from the server using GET.
        """
methods.name: _handle_redirects
